intro: Koanophyllon hypomalacum, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant has slender, upright stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctively narrow appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
